data.title: Quadriga Asset Managers
data.meta_description: the team The key to Quadriga’s success lies in our team. Thanks to their extensive experience, they bring an innovative and valuable vision to each of our clients. Each member of our team brings his or her talent and character to our products Here are all the managers and analysts in charge of managing our... Read More →
data.text:
Diego has over 21 years of experience in the industry. Prior to joining Quadriga, he worked for JP Morgan, Goldman Sachs, Merrill Lynch, Nareco, BlueCrest, DymonAsia Capital and Old Mutual.

Diego holds a degree in mining and petroleum engineering from the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid and two master’s degrees in economics related to oil and minerals.

Alfonso has more than 24 years of experience in the sector. Before joining the Vitrio team, he worked for Société Générale, Dresdner Bank, Banco Guipuzcoano, BBVA.

He holds a degree in Economics and Finance from the Universidad Autónoma de Madrid.

With 25 years of industry experience, Rodrigo is the Managing Director of Rho Investments and Founding Partner of Auriga Global Investors, making him one of the most respected participants in the Spanish fixed income and credit markets. Prior to co-founding Auriga in 2007, Rodrigo was Head of Fixed Income Trading at Caja Caminos and Head of Fixed Income Trading at Activos de Renta. Rodrigo holds a degree in Business Administration and Economics from the University of Wolverhampton in the UK (1995).

José Mosquera has over 23 years of experience in investment, proprietary trading and market making in different asset classes in both cash and derivatives. He was Managing Director responsible for managing pan-European credit trading teams for Barclays Capital, UBS, and HSBC. In addition, he holds a Master’s degree in International Securities, Investment and Banking from Henley Business School in the UK (1997).

Jose Maria Aznar Botella has experience in money management since 2000. He is the co-CIO of AZ Total Return Fund, and principal partner of Poniente Capital. In addition, he is a senior advisor for Cerberus Capital Management , and serves on the board of Haya Real Estate, the largest special servicer in Spain with over 30 billion AUM.

From 2002-2009 he worked as a senior analyst for SLS Management ($1Bn AUM), a New York based Hedge Fund, responsible for investments in a wide set of sectors in Europe and the US consumer sector. Prior to that he was an associate consultant for the Boston Consulting Group in both the Madrid and the New York offices. From 2010-2012, Jose Maria was a professor in the economics Faculty of Universidad San Pablo CEU, teaching the subjects of Management of Financial Companies and Securities Analysis. Jose Maria has a BA in Business Administration by the Colegio Universitario de Estudios Financieros (CUNEF).

Christian Thum joined Quadriga in 2021 as co-CIO of AZ Total Return. He started his career at Solomon Brothers Asset Management in 1994. He joined Goldman Sachs Frankfurt within the equity division in 1995. From 2000-2002, he was head of Goldman’s German Shares Equity Trading managing a team of six traders before transferring to London in European shares trading. In 2004, he helped to create the Merrill Lynch London Strategic Investment Group (internal hedge fund). At Merrill, he ran his own long/short equity portfolio and managed a team of over 20 investment professionals with a combined portfolio of several billion dollars.

In 2008, Christian joined Marble Bar Asset Management as a partner, where he ran part of the main Fund. In 2011, Christian joined BTG Pactual as a Portfolio Manager before joining the Mako Group in 2013 and subsequently launching CT Invest Fund in October 2014.

José is a Senior Analyst at Rho Investments and has 14 years of industry experience. Prior to joining Quadriga, José was a credit “special situations” analyst at Auriga Global Investors and previously an equity analyst at Mirabaud Securities and Ahorro Corporación.

José is a two-time winner of the Starmine Reuters Award for best analyst in the Spanish market. José holds an MBA from IESE Business School and London Business School.

With 8 years of experience, Jorge is an Senior Analyst at Rho Investments, specializing in financials. Jorge was an M&A analyst at UBS London (4 years) before moving to their Madrid office as an Associate Director (1 year).

Jorge holds a B.A. in Business Administration from Cunef and completed a year of his undergraduate studies at the University of South Carolina.

José has more than 25 years of experience in the financial and tax sector developing his career at KPMG, Santander, Chase Manhattan and Merrill Lynch, where he spent 18 years, until 2014 when he arrived at Auriga to create the Wealth Management department transferring the Know How of the big houses to independent multifamily offices platforms.

José is a graduate of ICADE (Lawyer and Business Advisor) and is registered as a Broker in New York (Series 7) and in commodities in Chicago (Series 3).

Carlos has 15 years of professional experience, starting in the financial sector in the Wealth Management department at Auriga in 2014, developing the work of financial advisor.

Carlos has a degree in Law from the Complutense University of Madrid and holds the title of MiFid II Financial Analyst.

Carmen has over 25 years of experience in the financial sector, developing her professional career at Chase Manhattan and Merrill Lynch, where she spent 14 years, until 2014 when she arrived at Auriga with José as Head of Client Services.

Carmen holds the title of MiFid II Financial Analyst.

Juan José has more than 25 years of experience in the financial markets working with institutional and individual investors. He co-founded Elcano Sicav in 2009, before that he worked for 10 years as Managing Director at the American bank Merrill Lynch in New York, London and Madrid. Previously he worked at Bankers Trust in New York and started his professional career in the treasury of Banco Santander managing portfolios for the bank.

Juan José has been collaborating with Quadriga’s broker VELAR Inversiones since 2020, offering clients his differentiated approach to independent wealth management.

He holds a degree in Business Administration and Management, a Master in Quantitative Finance, and a PDG from IESE. He is a professor of BME’s Master in Finance and Alternative Investments (MFIA). He holds the title of MiFID II Financial Analyst.

Miguel has 1 year of experience in private banking. Previously, he worked at Ernst & Young in the financial audit area. He also worked at Corpfin Capital and Incus Capital Advisors as a financial analyst.

Miguel holds a double degree in Business Administration and International Relations from IE Business School and is currently pursuing a Master in Corporate Finance and Value Investing at ISBIF Finance School. Candidate to CFA program.

Elena has more than 20 years of experience in the financial sector. She has developed her career as Client Service Officer at Merrill Lynch (Bank of America), supporting the business area (dream team). She began her professional career as a management secretary at Merrill Lynch Española Agencia de Valores.

She holds a degree in Philology from the Complutense University of Madrid. She is trilingual in Spanish, French and English. She holds a MiFId II Financial Analyst degree.

Victor has more than 25 years of experience in the financial sector and has developed his professional career in large American institutions, mainly at Goldman Sachs and Merrill Lynch in New York, London and Madrid.

Victor has a degree in Business Administration and Management, and holds Series 7, Series 3 and Series 63 qualified and SFA registered qualifications.
